text: in the town of batty cloer they're
grieving at almost every corner pictures
hang in memory of the young lives that
were lost for Eurasian who just turned
13 for John who loved basketball for am
seeker who was too for the other
children killed at church
they've been attending Sunday school
this footage was filmed 20 minutes
before the bombers struck after class
some of them went outside for snacks
before Easter service twelve-year-old
naruban was one of the children who
stayed inside suddenly we heard loud
noises he told me
we looked out and saw glass and
motorbikes flying around and heard
screams and shouts at least 25 people
died in the blast here at Zion Church 13
were children new ribbons mother
Christian P was one of the Sunday School
teachers her husband Ramesh was at the
church which was packed with worshippers
when he spotted a stranger with a
backpack the man told my husband he was
carrying a camera and wanted to film
inside she told me my husband said he
couldn't enter and forced him to leave
as I went into the church the bomb
exploded Ramesh died but his actions
saved lives naruban and his sister now
have to live bears without a father and
for Co Shanthi now a widow
the pain is all too familiar her parents
were brutally murdered in Sri Lanka
Civil War her aunt died in a tsunami
in this small Christian community entire
families have been wiped out
Sundari lost her son a daughter-in-law
and her 18 month old grandson job is
just around the corner
we found another memorial poster of two
smiling children yesterday brother and
sister Sharon and Sarah were buried side
by side they were just 11 and 12 both
love to study still on the wall in their
house their homework calendar I'll never
see them again
their mom very bottom all told me since
they've been gone all I can remember are
their smiles and laughter they won't
come back again that's the reality 10
years after the Civil War ended this
communities once again burying its dead
these graves have barely been dug
just like the lives lost her barely been
lived Rajini violin arvind BBC news
batter Chloe
